meanings.definition: The state or quality of being unable to function or operate effectively.
meanings.sent1: The unworkability of the old machine caused delays in production.
meanings.sent2: The unworkability of the plan led to its abandonment.
meanings.sent3: The unworkability of the broken clock made it a piece of art.
meanings.sent4: The unworkability of the situation was like trying to swim in quicksand.
meanings.sent5: The unworkability of the system was evident in its constant malfunctions.

meanings.definition: The condition of being impractical or not feasible.
meanings.sent1: The unworkability of the proposal made it difficult to implement.
meanings.sent2: The unworkability of the design became apparent during testing.
meanings.sent3: The unworkability of the idea was comically obvious to everyone.
meanings.sent4: The unworkability of the solution was like trying to fit a square peg in a round hole.
meanings.sent5: The unworkability of the project was a major setback for the team.
